Go there for the steak only! I think the steak is humongous, so I always ended up taking some home. The steak is always juicy, comes with tasty home fries potato (with onion) and a small bowl of very fresh coleslaw and pickles. I love the red peeper pickles they have there, sweet and spicy! Beer  selection is on the sad side... Desserts? don't bother, you have no room for it anyway.

This place holds a secret and the secret is a ginormous back area with full bar and tons of seating. Wow!We decided to hit up Arthur's Tavern for St. Patrick's Day (Hoboken style) this year and it worked out perfect. Our group was well over 20 people so finding a place that didn't charge 20$ to get in AND give us room to sit and hang out was definitely a plus.Arthur's had a 5 minutes wait to get in and we immediately had a waitress bringing us pitcher after pitcher, shot after shot, snack after snack. Throw in a great atmosphere, speedy bartenders and friendly wait staff dealing with the St. Pattys day drunk crew and you have a winner.I was so surprised at how big the back room was as it doesn't look like much space from the street. Perfect for a big events as there are TV screens all over I'd be interested to see how else this place is used.
During lunch hours, We saw a mouse run across the dining area and the hostess only shrugged. This place used to be good but it needs a clean up!!

Ruth's Morton's Fleming its not. But at half the price, it shouldn't be expected to be. This is your Tuesday night out with the guys place or the  after a family activity place. Nothing is "great" but every meal I have had here has been really good and if you take price into consideration, it has been great. I like the free pickles, hot peppers and slaw and the burgers and especially the steak were really good and incredibly fairly priced. I think my guest's top shelf martini was the cheapest I've paid in years. Go with your friends, go with your family or go alone,(sit at the bar, it's less obvious) but do go and give Arthur's a try.

Good food, great prices, decent beer selection. Very casual steakhouse is probably the best description for it.Great for a big or small meeting of friends, with tons of space inside. Will definitely be back.

It says a lot when a NYC girl would trek into Jersey just to have some meat from this place. I would fast for the whole day just so I could finish my dinner. I no longer live in NY, but often wish I did since I have yet to find a comparable steakhouse on the west coast.The portions at Arthurs are large, so arrive hungry. And while the garlic bread and potatoes are tempting and tasty, I recommend bypassing the carbs to save some room for the main event -- the fat piece of juicy steak.  After dinner, I wouldn't plan anything active since you'll seriously lapse into a food coma; I bet you'll be sleepy, but definitely satisified.

We came here only once, but it has left an impression on us.  Their steaks are big, good and CHEAP.  The garlic bread is seriously to die for.  They also have pickles, which was a bit strange for me (especially since I don't like them) but hey, whatever pleases the people, huh?The lighting is kind of weird, it's sort of dark, but with neon lights.  The staff is friendly, and the crowd is usually LOUD.  Don't expect to have a decent conversation here, or a good date.  Come here if you want to NOT talk to your date (or if she/he is boring).Can't wait to come back here again!  Too bad going to NJ costs us a pretty penny on the Lincoln Tunnel :(

OMG... meat-eater's paradise!!! Cows all over the world are either shaking in their boots or dying for a chance to be cooked up right in this cute lil' place.Arthur's serves up the most gorgeous steaks this side of the Atlantic! Always worth the extra effort to get out to Hoboken just to eat here. I also love the little bowls of pickles and hot peppers they serve up (for free - my favorite word), and the beer selection is excellent. But do not fill up on free pickles and beer, no matter how tempted you are to do so, because the steak they serve up is gi-normous and the best cut you'll eat in a long time.I really can't give enough praise to how delicious their steaks are... and the homemade, slightly garlicky, mashed potatoes on the side... Mmmmmmm!!! *drool*Be forewarned, however, that parking is atrocious in this area (but I'm not penalizing Arthur for that, since it's not his fault).

Very casual steak house.  It's like a big pub, or Sports  Bar., but I come here for steak.Their tables are sometimes greasy and sticky, and so-so sides..... yet and still, I have crossed the river from New York to come to the Arthur's, and I will again;  its the best value steak around, in my opinion. Perfect for casual dining with a group of friends.
The only good thing about this spot is their potatoes. That's it. Steak was supposed to be well done but was medium-well, soda was flat, and tables are too close together.

Outstanding!  Great steaks at great prices.  Prepare your GOUT medicines after eating these awesome pieces of cow...Vegetarians beware.  Steaks are grilled to perfection and are large enough for 2 people (24 onces or so)...I've only come here many times with my wife's family and we're a large (15+), noisy, and demanding group.  Arthurs handles big groups well and satisfies.Parking is horrendous in Hoboken...======================================================Update 13AUG07: Came for a Birthday Dinner for my brother-in-law.  Arthur's Tavern is consistently awesome.   Most of our party of 22 ordered the 24 ounce rib-eye extravaganza - and this is the "small" steak of the house.  My father who recently suffered a heart attack just last week should have been nowhere near this place!  But he was - he (and my sister-in-law) ordered the only fish dish of the house: Breaded and Baked Scrodd.   I'm not sure I've ever heard of this type of fish before tonight.  I had the only burger of the night - a Crumbled Blue Cheese Burger with Bacon.  Hmmmm heart healthy food yes!  But a steal at only $6.95.  I also got a side of Sauteed Mushrooms and the Potatoes.  The shrooms were excellent.  The potatoes would have been perfect if they had been crisp but were a nice side, since there were no fries.  If anything come to Arthur's Tavern for the 24oz rib-eye steaks, I prefer it here than at Ruth's Chris, which is overpriced and not as tasty as AT's.  pix laters...

The trip from my UES neighborhood to Hoboken is beyond worth it (every time) for the tastiest steak in the tri-states! Hubby and I would swim if we had to!  The garlic bread is worth every calorie! We had Matt as our server on our last visit and he was perfect. Thanks Matt!

If you are looking for great steak & potatoes without breaking the bank, come to Arthurs. It's not Wolfgang's or Luger's but so what? Their steaks are thick and juicy and the potatoes are crispy & oily. The complimentary pickles and peppers will jump start your appetite. Don't forget their garlic bread. So you'll be able to make an awesome steak sandwich the next day because you WILL have leftovers.Warning - Hard to find parking.

I'm in this thing called the Fatboy Fantasy Football League. Basically all the original guys except one or two are well north of 200 pounds. Most of those guys are closer to 250. We have two divisions - The Morbidly Obese Division and the Chubby Division - and at the end of the year we get together for a group dinner. Arthur's is one of the few places where our 'large' group can be happy. Meat. Meat. Meat. The 24 ounce steak for about 24 bucks or the 16 ounce Sirloin for those Fatboys watching their figures. Either way the steaks are pretty good and pretty darn cheap. I also like the baby back ribs which are a couple inches too big for the plate. It's good food, a lot of it and about half the price of a NY steak house. Beer on tap, decent sides, pickles and slaw on every table. All in all a great bargain and great place for a bunch of Fatboys.Wheelchair Access: Getting in is easy. Big tables. I didn't check the bathroom. I will and then I'll update.

One thing you need to understand first is that Hoboken doesn't have a lot of great eateries. Once you've accepted this, you can then wonder the different restaurants it has. Arthur's Tavern is a good thesis.Well located in midtown, Arthur's Tavern is a "gem". Serving good steaks and quick service, you'll definitely leave a happy customer. The steak portions are very healthy and competently cooked and the atmosphere is quaint and local. The best part, it's well priced. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a good unhealthy meal.

Had dinner with 8 friends - we had planned on going to a Cuban restaurant, but they only had tables of 4. Went to Arthur's last minute and was very happy. Good service, good food. VERY fair price for Hoboken. Their ribeye steak sandwich is excellent. The atmosphere is fun & casual. Comfort food at its best.

I finally had the 24 oz. steak with one of my best friends, and when you order it medium well, charred but not burned on the outside, and smother it in A1 sauce with the best garlic bread and potatoes I have ever had....STILL AMAZING!!!!

This is a great place for a casual dinner, the ribs and sides were wonderful. They have plenty of seating so feel free to bring a group.The cusine is hearty American fare, the potatos, fries, mac n cheese, ribs, steaks, burgers, etc.I have eaten at the restaurant once and service was super friendly, we were promptly seated, and the ribs were delicious!I have ordered a burger take out from here before. Two things -- it was HUGE and it was the best burger I have had outside NYC!  It was ranked 1 or 2 on a lot of sites that is why I wanted to try it, but it was better than expected. Between calling to order and picking it up it took all about 30 minutes, so speed is good!

I love going to Arthur's.Whether it be the one in Hoboken or the one in North Brunswick.A steak's a steak, right?  Mm, but just going to Arthur's makes it so much better.1. I'm addicted to the cole slaw.2. Pickles! I'm addicted to the pickles too!3. Steak-- should I get the 24 ounce today or the 18 ounce?  (Who am I kidding, I get the 24!)I'd recommend other dishes, but I've honestly never had anything other than a steak, slaw and pickles.  Good enough for me!
Great atmosphere, totally inducive to down massive amount of beer. The steak.. it had so much fat which turn me off. I'd come back for the beer garden feel but i'll skip the steak

I love this place.  I have been going for years.  In fact, this was one of my "litmus test" restaurants for dates back in the day.  What would the guy order?  What would he think of my order?  A true test when you are getting near that one month point, but I digress.Big beers.  Big burgers.  Big steaks.  That about sums it up.  I have had a few other things--the salads, the frozen drinks, the garlic bread, the steak/shrimp combo, the small steaks.  But if you are coming here once, go for the honking big sirlion, or the burger that will cause you pain if you finish it.  It's Arthur's--go big or go home!And then go see your cardiologist.

Steaks that are low in price, but high in quality!  I love this place!  I have one 10 minutes from where I live in North Brunswick area, but if im in Hoboken and Im in a mood for a delicious steak that are huge in portion I definitely swing by the place.   Appetizer wise, I usually order garlic break with mozarella cheese on top of it!  I keep it simple here.  They come in nice and toasty and huge!  But they usually cut it up in pieces so you can share with friends!   I usually order "MY STEAK"  which is a 20-ounce steak!  I usually get grilled onions on top of it and I get it well done with the juices still flowing on every bite!  I also get a baked potato on the side!   If you are a big carnivore!  Dont hesitate to stop by this place! you wont regret it.  I never order desserts here because Im too full to eat anything after i devour the steak!  They usually  have dessert cakes available for you if you can still manage to fit something in that stomach of yours.

When I lived in Hoboken, I loved this place. Don't overlook the burgers, they are outstanding and put on a perfect kaiser roll. Gets four stars due to highly inconsistent service levels, but that is half the fun of this place.Sincerely,daviddalka.com/createval…
came here last night we were seated quickly and the food is always good fair price and good service no need for an app as the main course is more than enough

I came here for a meeting the other night.  I was told not to eat the pickles because they've been sitting in a tub down in the basement.  Regardless of where and how, they were excellent.  The steak was huge.  I would definitely share an entree here, unless you're really hungry.

Took my dad and kids to Arthurs this past weekend and the food and service was much better.  Everything was served hot and the service was very good.  Maybe because I haven't been there in a year or they had an off day when I last here... but when in the neighborhood, I would eat there again.  Arthurs is an institution.

originally this was 4 stars. because i saw a mouse after my meal, i shall revise for 3 stars. the thought of mice near my carnivorous heaven is disturbing.for hudson restaurant week a friend and i decided to have the prix-fixesteak dinner with all the basic fixins: steak + starch, in this case some fried potatoes. a salad came with too but that wasn't memorable. after all, we are here for the meat. the steak arrived and as i ordered, it cameperfectly medium rare.  the fat and meat quotient were as expected andthe crust on the outside of the steak was on-point. my potatoes were good and nothing to rave on about, the integrity of the spud is thus, but nothing sensational. i ordered my steak with an additional side of mushrooms that lended the buttery and earthy level i wanted to enhance my steak experience. the complimentary pickles, coleslaw,  and peppers are a nice touch that add to a family-run atmosphere.over all, i would give them 4 stars. then again, there was a mouse we noticed scurry right at our feet as soon as we paid the bill. the servers when we told them were panicked themselves and didn't respond in a logical manner-- discount on the meal, a free dessert or beverage? not at all.

I came in to NJ to see a friend. He is a great friend. We were looking for a place to go eat on a Saturday night. We were looking for something nice and easy but tastes great at the same time. Hmmm, we thought. What could that be??? So, we asked SIRI, the genderless voice on the iPhone, and she brought up Arthur's Tavern. After reading the reviews on Yelp, we decided to give it a go. Upon arrival, we were seated promptly with no wait. Remember, this is a Saturday night... There was plenty of room for seating. However, of all of the good spots, our host seated us between 2 large groups. Not my choice of seating but we made it work. After reviewing the menu, we ordered right away. We both ordered burgers, I had bacon on mine and my friend had no bacon. We thought our burgers came with cole slaw. However, we realized they only came with fries. After informing us that the burgers did not come with slaw, we were very surprised when our waitress surprised us with 2 free helpings of cole slaw!!! For free!! Talk about great service!! After precisely 10 minutes, we received our food. Let me tell you, the burgers were TO DIE FOR!!! they were excellent. So seasoned to perfection. i'm talking mouth watering. Amazing. The fries were good as well, however they were just fries. Nothing to rave about. After the meal, our server brought us the check in a very timely manner. We were out of there and on our way to get some ice cream in no time. PROS- Good service- Amazing burgers- Friendly peopleCons- Could have seated us better- Faster on the refills please- Background music did not fit the environment at times

I love me a great dive.  This place serves great big steaks the size of the plates.  While it's not the best cut of beef, it is juicy with lots of flavor.  The garlic bread is good but the pickles are nasty (but I don't like pickles, so don't take my word for it).  The prices are super cheap for the amount of food you get.  The place is a little grungy with the checkered plastic table cloths, dark wood paneling and brass bars.  It feels more like a converted speakeasy than a restaurant.  You may have to wait for a seat, but it's usually worth it.  Come hungry and you definitely will not leave that way.

I'm a steak lover and it's no surprise that I would love this place. My boyfriend told me about this restaurant a while ago since he's been coming there with his family and during his college years with his friends. We finally visited May 2010 and food was amazing. We ordered the garlic bread for appetizers and its probably the best garlic bread i've ever had. It was very warm and soft and it was just amazing. We both had the 24 oz. steak which is served with potatoes. Everything was so juicy and flavorful and amazing. I couldn't finish my steak so I had some left over and had it the next day for lunch..still soo good. Although the service wasn't really that great, I would definitely come back here again and again for the food.

just imagine a 48 oz four in thick steak being plunked down in front of you...is it a dream? or is it Arthurs?The slaw is already waiting on the table when you arrive.  Crowded, this place is not the intimate romantic dinner scene, but for the meat & taters hunger pang-you hit it on the nose.Finish up with a mousse pie....finnesse!
Nice intimate cabin type place. Great steak & shrimp.

Arthur's combines great food with great value. The steaks came out cooked to perfection and with the potatoes as their signature side dish it can't be beat. Watch out for those cherry peppers... they sure add a little kick to your food. The garlic bread was tasty and fresh and the mixed greens salad was also good. Overall I can't complain. Just be ready to leave room for dessert. Service was quick and friendly.

The garlic bread is fantastic and the steaks are hit or miss.  I do enjoy the potatoes, but for the same price, I could get a steak somewhere else that has a lot for flavor and consistency to it.  The steaks also come on the fatty side.

The service is not fantastic, but the steaks are really affordable. The potatoes with onions are really good. They also offer lobster, which is not printed in their menu (but written on a chalk board) which they do very well without overcooking. But don't try their fish and other shrimp dishes - dried out and fishy! Their big steaks are juicy and good. Although, occasionally they don't give you a good cut of the steak and it has a lot of...tendons or something chewy/stringy but about 95% of the time it's a good cut.Go with the big steak and not the sirloin (much more dry than the main steak dish they offer) and shrimp combo, for example.

I went here with a group of at least 20 people and they handled us like there were two of us.The steaks are unbelievable.  Definately a place to check out if you're in the area and you haven't eaten in a few days.  The place really fills you up.

I can't believe the great ratings this place has been getting. I went for dinner once and I felt like I was in a YMCA cafeteria. That picture of the steak says it all too. I think we need to raise our standards here people. Five stars is a fillet mignon at Peter Lugers or a Porterhouse at Ruth's Chris. This is hardly even diner food... All I can say for it is that the portions are large and the prices are cheap. But when you want to be cheap, maybe you should skip the steak joints and head to mickey d's instead.

If you're in the mood for good, cheap steak and lots of it, Arthur's the place for you.  Medium rare might come out a little too medium for most steak lover's tastes, but for the price and portion size it's hard to really complain that loudly.  The side of potatoes with onions is surprisingly excellent. think there's a hint of tomatoe sauce in it. If you need more carbs, have the fantastic piping hot garlic bread. It's loaded with parmesean cheese as well. Plenty of beer is on tap as well.

So many people say they like this place.  Im sorry but the food is sub par at best.  The steak is flat out gross and I have turned down several offers from friend offering to by me a Rib-eye there.  I have tried several times before to see what the hype was and all three time I get the green apple splatters for the rest of the night.  Hoboken is not a place where you want to have that.  This happens because they soak these steaks in butter or some kind of oil.  I have to know why people like this place.  Is everyone in this town brainwashed and afraid to say it sucks.  I gave 1 extra star because they do my favorite thing here.  They serve a bowl of pickles and hot peppers before the meal.

When we lived in Hoboken, Arthur's was our favorite place to eat.  We took everyone who came to visit us there.  I know this sounds like an odd thing to write about a steak house. But OMFG, the pickles there are so freaking good, it wouldn't matter if the rest of the food was drivel, it would be worth it.  But it's not drivel.  Their burgers are amazing (I am partial to mushroom and swiss, but they are all delish!), their potatoes are killer and their steaks are the best in town!  With lots of great beer available, there's not much more you can ask for.

Go hungry. The steak is enormous, and the cut is a delmonico rib-eye. Lots of heavy, beefy, chewy meat. Does it have flavor? Yes indeed. But it's not the greatest cut of meat, certainly not a 'melt-in-your-mouth' kind of steak. i could only finish half of my 24-ouncer (very rare i can't finish a steak). My favorite part of the dining experience has got to be the pickles and peppers you get at the beginning of the meal. Skip the iceberg & tomato salad, it's nothing special (inferior to most steakhouses). The burger, however, is recommended (i've gotten the blue-cheese burger, it's real nice). The potatoes that come with the steak were decent, if you like mushy potatoes, but they were tasty.

Arthur's has always been a "safe bet" place in Hoboken.  Steaks are very good, especially for the price.  I'm into steaks, but I usually need to have white rice, so I opt for the burger.  My wife usually can't finish a whole steak, so I benefit off her shortcomings.  When I usually order the burger, people think I'm nuts, because when you go to a steak house, you don't order the burger.  They are usually left for the non-adventurous and the kiddies.  Call me non-adventurous, but I think I've discovered the best burger in Jersey.  It comes out like an average no-frills burger, bun, and veggies on the side.  Once you sink your teeth into that meat, you'll be hooked.  5 stars for the burger alone!!!!

Arthur's is a great place to hang out and wind down, especially with a group of friends. The prices are really good and the steak is nice and juicy. It's a no frills place and the plate comes pretty basic with potatoes on the side. I found that the steak is cooked so well that you don't even need to use any kind of steak sauce. Compared to the steak at the pricey Palm Restaurants in Manhattan, I actually prefer Arthur's steak. I haven't tried anything else on the menu but then again I don't know anyone who has. Can't go wrong with Arthur's.

What a great place!  Absolutely the best steaks for the money.  They might come with some fat on them, but, as the son of a butcher, you want your steak cooked with fat on it...it adds flavor.  Most of the fat is easy to trim away as you eat the enormous 24 ounce Delmonico.  The only ones who will be disappointed with this restaurant are those who want to eat "health conscious" food.  But then again, why would a vegetarian eat in a steakhouse?  You wouldn't expect the Rabbi to love the ham and cheese, would you?   The biggest question about Arthur's is why they even bother to cook anything besides burgers and steaks.  A better value is hard to find.

Unless someone can tell me a better steakhouse in NJ, I would have to say this is one of the best places where I have eaten.  Arthur's is where I had my first good steak.  I was surprised that I even finished the 24oz steak (I'm kinda skinny).  But I like how your served with complimentary pickles and cole slaw.  When I got my 24oz steak, it was pretty tasty and it came with a lot of potatoes.  The homemade potatoes tasted great and nothing beats  homemade cooking.  Another thing that I like about this place is that our waiter was very friendly, made sure we were ok, and took care of me and my group when we were there.  I highly recommend this place because one main thing about this restaurant is that our order didn't take long even though the place was packed compared to other restaurants.  If i lived in Hoboken, I would spend at least two Sundays at Arthur's Tavern for dinner.

I live in hoboken, to me there isnt that much going on when it comes to restaurants in hoboke,  the Steaks here are Awesome i only ate here one time.  I am totattly in love with place I got the 24 oz Medium Rare it was the best ...My date just enjoyed the pickels and Peppers she was full ...Can't Beat that . Arthurs Rock

I ordered the petit sirloin with shrimp and rice and my friend ordered the bbq ribs. His ribs were really good but my petit sirloin was tough. I also ordered the strawberry daiquiri and it was terrible. Luckily I was able to change the drink to a pina colada and it was much better. The service was ok.but there famous potatoes were greasy. I wouldnt come back.
Great place for casual dining or drinks with friends.  The wait staff is super friendly and the garlic bread is delish!

The burgers here are great (especially with blue cheese on them) but the magical little extra is the homemade pickles and coleslaw you get with anything you order.  Yum!  Also ladies, this place is full of cute young men most of the time, so if you want to shoot fish in a barrel, this is the place to do it ;)

I was experiencing iron deficiency anemia and was in need to replenish my supply of iron.  I was craving medium rare meat.  I convinced the bride-to-be to drive with me to Hoboken to check out Arthur's Tavern for some steak--one of the 7 things I am to accomplish here in New Jersey.  We drive there from Passaic, which took a little less than 20 minutes (not counting the 20 minutes of time we took getting lost and taking pictures of the Manhattan skyline at Hamilton Park).  I've been warned by her groom that parking is a bitch over at Hoboken.  I smirked at the warning because he wishes he had the good parking karma that I usually have. When I turned right on Washington Street, I almost ran over this HOT ESTAP dude (he was cute)... and the parking situation looked grim.  However, I spotted a space and finally took it.  Whatttayakno!?  The space was literally about 50 feet from Arthur's Tavern.  We didn't have to circle around for parking either!My friend and I walked in and was greeted by a hostess.  She directed us to the main dining room, where we were greeted by a 2nd host.  He was foine.  We were seated at this table that was covered with red/white checkered tablecloth.  The place looked like it was great for groups, and there were televisions on top of the bar for those just in to drink beer and watch the games.  Our server's name was Carolyn.  I ordered a Corona Light and my friend tried to order a Blue Hawaii, but they did not have Blue Curacao likka.  I got cold because I'm an old lady and the table was directly in front of the air conditioner.  We asked to be moved, but that meant we had to change servers.  Carolyn was fine with it, joking that she wanted to go home anyway.  Then came Roger.  I already liked his name.  Do you know Prince's name is Roger Nelson?  Anyways... our server, Roger, had this confident gait.... he walked like he's packin'.  He is also hella foine.  Too bad he wasn't on the menu.My evening is getting better.  I ordered the junior sirloin (12 oz) and my friend ordered the petite sirloin (8oz) with the shrimps (and came with an olive oil-cilantro sauce).  I ordered my meat medium rare.  She ordered hers rare.  When the food came in, my steak was perfect--pink, juicy, tender, and oh so flavorful.  Hers, on the other hand, looked medium rare.  She was clearly disappointed by the done-ness of her meat.  As the maid of honor, I felt it was my duty to make sure that the bride-to-be is as close to being stress free before the wedding... so I asked if her food could be redone.  Another server suggested that she get her steak "black and blue"--the steak is seasoned and charred quickly, while leaving the inside rare.  When her replacement meat came in, it looked like it was still moving when she cut through the steak.  I appreciate that they didn't give us much resistance for this request.  She was clearly happy and even finished the entire steak.  I thoroughly enjoyed my pink meat and wish Roger could've given me some of that special sauce that came with my friend's meal.  The steak did come with pickled hot red peppers which was a glorious compliment to the steak.  I felt like I was eating an upgraded taco without the tortilla.   They are also proud of their burgers and list of specials including a filet mignon sandwich and Manhattan clam chowder.  4.5 stars for the steak and 0.5 stars for Roger = 5 stars for Arthur's Tavern!

My uncle took me here for the first time and I'm very happy he introduced me to this great tavern!  Excellent steak, cooked medium rare as I ordered.  The potatoes that came on the side were really yummy too.  I started with a cup of the potato leek soup that hit the spot.  If you're in a steak and potatoes mood, you'd best try this out!

I didn't have a steak here, because it was lunchtime, and I'm not really much of a steak person.  I am, however, a cheeseburger person, and the cheeseburgers here are outstanding, probably some of the best I've had anywhere.  They serve really great pickles and pickled tomatoes to start you off, and then you can order a side of grilled onions or mushrooms to go with your enormous cheeseburger, along with some home-friesish potatoes.  It makes for an incredibly filling, dense, satisfying, and reasonably-priced meal.  I'm sure I'll be back on a regular basis.

I met my wife here, she orders the ladies cut med-rare, sparks flew; and then I ate my 20 oz. and my quart of beer.  It is not a fancy place but, if you want good food and beer at a good price and prefer minimal frills then this is your place.

Old school, no frills steak that's aaallll about MEAT, baby.  There's only five categories of stuff on the menu:  burger, big honkin' steak, even bigger that-for-real (48oz) steak, oh ya fish filet (for you vegetarians, hah), and something to GO with your steak.  Do NOT miss out on the home fries.  I jones for that stuff from all the way out in the West, and no matter how much I've experimented, I cannot duplicate the magic.

I've been to Arthur's two times now, one time for lunch where we eat outside and just recently for dinner where we eat inside.  First off, this place is surprisingly huge and I had a challenging time finding my way back from the bathroom.  The place is filled with tables and there are two separate bars in the back where patrons were watching sports on flat screens.  Just a good vibe overall.  They start you off with complimentary cole slaw, pickles and hot peppers which were all very good. It's ironic that they offer you these freebies, because apparently they charge you for water.  I ordered a big beer, so this strange policy didn't affect me.  For a steak place, Arthur's is reasonably priced.  Even the sirloin and shrimp dish was around $25.00.  I've had the ribs (excellent) and on another occasion the corn beer sandwich which was very lean and delicious.  I also recommend ordering some of their side dishes like their famous potatoes, fried onions and sauteed mushrooms.  If you're in Hoboken, make every effort to try Arthur's.

I have no clue how up until me this place has received all 5 star reviews.  Apparently huge portions are all that matter these days.Starting New Years, like most New Years, I went on a low carb diet to slim back down for about the 6th or 7th time in the past 5 or 6 years.  Trying to think of a place I could eat without limiting myself too much, the first word that popped in my head was "steakhouse", and other than seeing this place all the time it seemed to get pretty good reviews.  A look at the menu from outside revealed that it was short (usually a good sign for a place like this) and relatively affordable, as well as more than compatible with my diet.  The huge steaks here seemed to be the main attraction.We started with a salad of greens with an addition of crumbled blue cheese which turned out to not just be greens since it contained olives, sliced red onions, and sliced tomatoes on it.  I have no complaints about this other than the fact that the tomatoes were obviously out of season, but they were relatively (and I stress the word relatively) decent for out of season tomatoes.  We were also given complimentary pickles and hot peppers to start, which was nice alternative to bread for someone who is staying away from carbs.I ordered their signature steak, which is 24 ounces, a side of mushrooms and a side of sauteed onions.  The steak came with potatoes, which I couldn't eat because of my diet, but I don't think it will effect my judgment at all because I could tell by looking at them what they taste like.  It's not hard to tell that they are just red bliss potatoes that have been blanched and sliced and then sauteed.  Anyways as for the steak, the mushrooms, and the onions... do these motherfuckers even have salt in their fucking kitchen?  I tasted none in the onions or mushrooms and barely a hint on the steak.  I really hope the potatoes were the exception, but I doubt it.  Everything was cooked fine but what the fuck, I don't want to sit there shaking a salt shaker my whole fucking meal.  Steak is not the kind of thing you are supposed to put a little sprinkle of salt on and then grill.  Maybe these people that cover their steak in steak sauce or ketchup don't notice it, but if you aren't making me a sauce in the kitchen then I don't want to have to rely on one.  This may have possibly been the most underseasoned meal I have ever had in my life.  On top of that, the girl I was with ordered a combination of steak and shrimp, and the shrimp (aside from also being undersalted) were overcooked and rubbery.  The obvious reason people come here is the size of the steaks, the signature one being 24 ounces, but smaller ones and bigger ones (obviously not for one person) are also available.  The price for the size is reasonable, about 22 or 23 bucks, I don't remember exactly... but the problem is that they only serve sirloin steaks.  For those of you that don't know, sirloins are the cheapest of the "premium" steaks, and unless specified as top sirloin (which it isn't here), it's the even less expensive bottom sirloin.  It's how this place profits off huge affordable steaks, and it's  also the steak of choice for other places (such as Sizzler) that are trying to pull a profit at a lower price.  The advantage of the bottom sirloin, other than it's price, is that like most tougher and cheaper cuts it's packed with flavor.  The disadvantage is the sinew, gristle, and higher amount of connective tissue which means you have to do some heavy chewing even at medium rare... and 24 ounces of heavy chewing is a lot of work.  I find any steak to be inedible at well done but even those godforsaken well done eaters will probably find a sirloin inedible at their preferred level of doneness.  I don't know about anybody else, but if this is a steakhouse, I would like to at least have the option to spend a little more money for a ribeye, NY strip or porterhouse.  I guess the problem is that they know if they put a 24 ounce portion of any of those cuts on the menu, they are going to have to charge too much money to keep advertising their affordability.  Oh well... it seems like they do enough business without it anyway.

It's like walking into a restaurant from the past, signs, table and how they serve you, very friendly. A little crowded and not ideal if there's more than 8 of you, but great if you'd like to keep it simple and hang with a good friend. Parking sucks of course but a good place to visit once the summer movie in the park series starts up again.

While visiting some friends in New York City I was able to tag along on a trip out to Arthur's in Hoboken.  Turns out a guy they were good friends with wanted to celebrate his birthday with an Arthur's steak, and I can understand why!  I couldn't resist ordering what EVERYONE else at the table ordered...steak (mine was medium/rare).  After taking my first bite I entered a state of meat loving bliss.  This was some quality cow.  Coming from Chicago, the home of stock yards and meat packing...I have had my fair share of good beef.  I have to admit though, Arthur's was up there with some of the best.  Juicy, tender and full of flavor.  What really stood out in my mind was how great the atmosphere was.  Not stuffy, full of all kinds of different people and great for a group.  If I ever get out to Hoboken again I will definitely stop in.

I had a burger here.  From all my other reviews, you can probably see that I really enjoy good hamburgers.  But this one just didnt really do it for me.  I didn't think there was much taste to it.  And all the other sides we had... weren't too memorable either, because I can barely remember what we had.  I think mushrooms and something.  Nothing too special here.
food,service, drinks, atmosphere is the bomb!

Arthur's is a real treasure in Hoboken. Sure you can get a good steak a few other places, but this is Steakhouse! Every table starts off with complimentary pickles, tomatoes, peppers and sauerkraut. What class! Unfortunately, that's about where it stops. The spartan decor can be forgiven for the restaurant's nature, but not the styrofoam plates. Service is decent for a steakhouse, but certainly nothing special - that's left for the food.Their 24oz. Delmonico Rib-Eye can be a bit gristly, but is juicy, packed with flavor, and always cooked to order, plus it comes with some pretty decent home fries. If you want the perfect steak, you'll have to go to Manhattan or to Peter Luger's for a dry-aged porterhouse, but Arthur's isn't trying to compete with those $40/steak bigboys. Afterall, a side of onions (greasy, not caramelized) is a mere 99 cents! Add in a side of mushrooms (greasy but cooked just right) and you've get yourself a great meal. Although not as perfect as their signature steak, Arthur's offers excellent burgers, ribs and a slew of decent deli sandwiches, not to mention their specials. My only real gripe with Arthur's is that their wine and beer menus leave much to be desired. The wine list is (barely) passable, but like everything else, extremely well priced.

I was at the Hoboken location once, I thought it was just OK.  I will say I thought the garlic bread was delicious, as was the mozzarella caprese.  The steak however left much to be desired.  The sign on the place saying they have the best steaks or whatever is quite misleading.  Now I will say I am very picky when it comes to steak, I eat it quite a bit.  I ordered a medium cooked sirloin, which was medium-well and lacked in flavor.  The bottom line was the steak was just OK; not very flavorful and somewhat overcooked.  If I were to go back I would definitely get the garlic bread, however I would most likely just order a burger as opposed to one of the steaks.

If you're cool enough not to care about being in a fancy looking restaurant and you're craving for good steak but has less than 50 bucks in your wallet, this is the place for you. Dont complain about the interiors of this place as long as you're happy with the 23 dollar 24 ounces steak.

So what if it feels like the bar around the corner?  If you want cheap meat, this is the place to go.  You can stuff yourself with a 24oz steak or a gorge yourself with a 48oz steak.  If you try the latter, it's so big you have to check to make sure the center is thoroughly cooked.  The mugs of beer are also a great bargain, they're more closer to a half pitcher than a mug.  This place is great for big parties and the stroll along Washington Street in Hoboken is a pleasant escape from the hustle and bustle of the big city on warm evenings.
